ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned about history of EU and how it's relevant to modern policymaking

Even though I did not know much about the European Union before this class, I was still able to broaden my understanding of the EU. The most important insight that I learned from this class is related to the structure of the EU which is a very complicated one.
Writing, reading skills, knowledge of the EU, political knowledge

This course allowed me to better understand the role and functions that the European Union carries out in Europe and the world. It also allowed me to further explore the future of the EU and how current events are influencing the entity's evolution.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the content of this course was really interesting, and I liked hearing from my peers. However, sometimes I wish we were able to talk more in small groups / breakout rooms, because it can be intimidating to speak on such high political levels in front of everyone.

This course allowed me to explore various parts of the EU, while also letting me more deeply focus on the roles of the EU that interested me personally, allowing for both a broad and more specialized understanding of the relevant material. The pace of the class was a bit slow, which made it sometimes difficult to stay focused on the material.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I think it's an interesting class for those who care about European politics, but I will say that the structure isn't for everyone as it's a lot of independent motivation, and there's much freedom. So you have to be very self motivated to get the most out of this course.
I would recommend this course to anyone particularly interested in the EU and is ready to come prepared for discussion during seminar.
